thread.title: Guardiola promises Arsenal fans won't be stung on return trip
thread.title_full: Guardiola promises Arsenal fans won't be stung on return trip - World - Sports - Ahram Online

author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Guardiola promises Arsenal fans won't be stung on return trip
text:
Related PHOTO GALLERY: Barcelona win, Arsenal defeat Bayern in Champions League Neuer puts hand up for Bayern defeat at Arsenal Bayern Munich missing perfection, luck in season's first defeat Giroud and Ozil lead Arsenal to victory over Bayern Match facts: Arsenal v Bayern Munich (UEFA Champions League) Bayern Munich coach has vowed Arsenal fans will not face inflated prices when they go to Germany after Bayern supporters protested against Champions League ticket costs at the London side.
German fans were cheered by their Arsenal counterparts when they staged their demonstration for the first five minutes of Tuesday's game in London which Arsenal won 2-0.
Arsenal visit Bayern for the return group match on November 4 and Guardiola said after the game: "I will speak with (Arsene) Wenger for next time to make it cheaper for our fans.
"We will take care of Arsenal fans in Munich with a good price. They can travel," he added.
"Â£64 a ticket but without fans football is not worth a penny," said banners held up at the start of the Champions League game before the German fans took their seats.
The 64 pound (87 euro) price is one of the highest in the Champions League for average seats.
Arsenal's allocation for the next Bayern match is already sold out.
